meanings.definition: To punish by dragging under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The pirate captain threatened to keelhaul the disobedient crew member.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, sailors would keelhaul those who broke the rules.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor joked that he would rather be keelhauled than swab the deck.
meanings.sent4: The idea of keelhauling the lazy crewmate was like a dark cloud hanging over the ship.
meanings.sent5: The thought of being keelhauled made the crew shudder in fear.

meanings.definition: A form of punishment involving dragging under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The crew dreaded the keelhauling punishment for serious offenses.
meanings.sent2: Keelhauling was a brutal practice used to maintain discipline at sea.
meanings.sent3: The sailor's exaggerated tale of being keelhauled had the crew chuckling.
meanings.sent4: The threat of keelhauling loomed over the ship like a shadow of fear.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of keelhauling sent shivers down the spines of the sailors.
